archimate:BusinessObject.name: Aggregate
archimate:BusinessObject.documentation:
An Aggregation is a collection of Information and functionality with very clear meaning for the business
For example, the aggregation "Customer" will provide most or all the needed Information and Functionality to complete the Activity
The Aggregation may use other aggregation to provide the functionality, but this is transparent for the business activity
Each Aggregation have a single IT Owner in IT organization(s) (it may have one in Architecture and one in Development and one in operations, but never 2 in Architecture or 2 in Development or 2 in Operations)
Each Aggregation have a single Business Owner
Each aggregation will have one or several Domain Experts (the guys that knows and can explain well the business to the IT)
The Information provided by an aggregated is structured in Entities. For example, the "Customer" aggregate can provide Customer Credit Rating information of the customer, or the customer positions
